Software Engineer

The Software Engineer writes and maintains code within applications and systems to implement capabilities and features, improve performance and maintainability, while reducing technical debt in alignment with product and technology roadmaps. The Software Engineer plays a role in Agile planning, providing advice and guidance, and monitoring emerging trends.

Key Responsibilities
Works with Product Management to understand the challenges that customers and end users face in their day-to-day work and partner with them to design viable solutions.
Recommends viable solutions to processes, technology, and interfaces that improve the effectiveness of the team and reduce technical debt.
Foresees capacity requirements for component usage and identifies limitations.
Provides input into story sizing, backlog grooming, and release planning.
Contributes to product and solution designs to address critical issues and complex problems.
Builds software applications across multiple platforms in response to the needs of stakeholders.
Understands technical architecture and writes software and automated tests that are aligned with agreed upon standards.
Performs trouble-shooting efforts and investigations when necessary.
Provides ongoing support, monitoring, and maintenance of deployed products.
Actively works with less experienced software engineers providing technical guidance and oversight.
Actively participates in the engineering community, staying up to date on new software technologies and best practices and shares insights with others in the organization.
Control system design practice within an enterprise or industry architecture.
Influence industry-based models for the development of new technology applications.
Develop effective implementation and procurement strategies, consistent with business needs.
Ensure adherence to relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices.
Design, code, test, correct and document programs and scripts from agreed specifications, and subsequent iterations, using agreed standards and tools, to achieve a well-engineered result.
Take part in reviews of own work and leads reviews of colleagues' work.
Establish standards and procedures across the technology service lifecycle (including the development lifecycle) in the areas of systems integration and testing and ensures that practitioners adhere to them.
Manage application enhancements to improve business performance.

Job Profile Summary

Role Synopsis

Our Global Oil Americas (GOA) business unit handles the supply and trading activities for BP’s oil and chemical businesses in the Americas. The GOA Information & Technology Services (IT&S) team works closely with the GOA business, providing and maintaining systems covering Trading through to Settlements.

As a Microsoft Developer within the EUC DevOps team, you will work closely with business users across all domains to develop, train and support applications/tools utilizing MS Office technologies including Excel, Access, Power BI, PowerApps, Power Automate and SQL Server. A high degree of expertise is required within VBA, SQL and other windows technologies.

The team is located near their business partners and you will have daily interactions with the business teams that you support. GOA derives competitive advantage and commercial differentiation from the use of technology in our trading activity. You will collaborate with commercial authorities to find opportunities to use information technology for commercial advantage.

You will be responsible for the full software development life-cycle environment participating in requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of these solutions. You should be able to design and develop applications that meet the business needs while keeping in line with the broader IT strategy of the group. You should also be able to develop and provide training offerings to our business partners on the latest features and functionalities within Office 365.

Key Accountabilities:
Collaborate with end users to quickly build and improve tools that support key business priorities using agile delivery methodologies
Design, develop, test, and deploy Microsoft Office 365 Applications
Automate highly complex reporting through BI application including visualization, parameters and report optimization
Support and improve existing MS Office 365 applications
Contribute to the overall implementation of tactical and strategic projects as part of the development team
Develop scalable, reusable components and application framework
Alignment to the development methods and practices established on the team and across globally
Produce concise and meaningful technical and functional documentation
Undertake analysis of systems, business processes, data and interfaces to tackle business problems
Provide prototypes for initiatives as needed
Liaise with Microsoft and the wider BP team (developers, Business Analysts, testers) to discuss bugs, new features, improvements designed to increase business value
Develop and conduct Office 365 training offerings to the end users including Power BI, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate

Job advert

Essential Education:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience

Essential Experience and Job Requirements:
Strong firsthand experience using Microsoft End User Computing (EUC) development tools (Excel, Access, Power BI, PowerApps, Power Automate, VBA)
Strong data warehouse application development, including visualization (reports and dashboards), parameters and report optimization
Proficient understanding of Business Intelligence solutions: operational and analytical
Strong knowledge of relational and multi-dimensional database architectures
Deep expertise with programming in VBA and SQL with MS Office 365 suite of applications (Power BI, Excel, Power Automate, Power Apps, Access etc.)
Track record of development and support in a trading floor environment
Experience in using source control applications
Good interpersonal skills

Desirable Criteria:
Familiarity with agile development methodologies
Strong business knowledge in finance and oil (energy trading)
Knowledge of at least one other core software development language: .NET / C#, Java / JEE, Python, SQL Server

About BP

At BP, we’re involved in every aspect of the energy system. With over 73,000 employees in 78 countries, we’re constantly working towards delivering light, heat and mobility to millions of people, every day. And our Supply and Trading business helps us buy and sell energy that is transported to customers all over the world.

Supply and Trading moves energy through pipelines and by ship, truck and rail, and trades everything from our energy commodities to derivatives and currencies. It’s a place where talent, team collaboration and a supportive environment come together to make it an exceptional area to build a successful career.

JOB DESCRIPTION

We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the RSI Frontline Development team working to address hot fixes, feature enhancements, collaborating with other developers on best practices, code reviews and process improvements. RSI’s team develops Revenue Premier® Enterprise Management products built in an N-tier architecture using a hybrid of C# and Java components on a SQL Server database.


Your role:

Responsibilities in the first year will include determining feasibility of/implementing change requests, investigating root causes of unexpected application behavior, addressing issues raised via ticketing system and following up with client-side colleagues. You will also share your experience by mentoring junior developers as they grow their technical skill base.

The position is challenging, but RSI provides support, training and you provide critical thinking and drive to achieve and streamline processes. Base salaries are just one aspect of our entire compensation package that may include medical, dental, and vision benefits, ability to contribute to flexible spending accounts and 401(K) plans, relocation assistance, ten paid holidays split between fixed holidays and floating holidays, and paid time off. Position is local to Roseville, CA.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
Immediate authorization to work in the US
5+ years of experience with one or more programming languages (i.e. C#, ASP, .NET, SQL, XML, JAVA)

Do you want to be part of a cutting edge, industry-changing company? How about the opportunity to be part of our team working out of a satellite office in the beautiful and convenient Roseville/Folsom area? Welcome to Work Truck Solutions! In 2012, the company was founded with the goal of revolutionizing the commercial truck industry. As of 2020, we haven’t just met that goal, we’ve crushed it! As we continue to change an industry and grow in size, we are finding ourselves in need of even more top talent! That’s where you come in.

What it's like to work at Work Truck Solutions

You'll be working on one of our development teams of 4-5 developers
You'll be working in an Agile Scrum environment
You'll help finalize the concepts, specs and architecture of our rapidly evolving platform
You'll be writing code, doing developer testing/verification, and doing peer code reviews
You'll be working on sprints that typically last between 2 - 3 weeks

Responsibilities

Build high quality, secure, and performant software according to specifications and time frames while still raising questions and clarifying early as needed
Follow established coding standards and best practices and write readable, maintainable code
Communicate effectively with a distributed team, raising issues and concerns promptly
When you first start, as part of your orientation, you may need to make a few trips to our main office in Chico, CA. Subsequent trips may be required from time to time

Required Skills & Experience

Computer Science or a related technical degree, or demonstrable equivalent expertise
Must have a strong understanding of JavaScript fundamentals
Must have a strong understanding of CSS, including box model, floats, and media queries
Must have an understanding of HTML fundamentals
2+ years of professional experience with jQuery
2+ years of professional experience with at least one modern, component-driven front-end framework such as React, Vue, Marko, Angular, Polymer, Svelte, etc
2+ years of professional experience writing and/or consuming RESTful web services
2+ years of professional experience with a component UI library, such as bootstrap, foundation, ant, material UI, etc.
1+ year of professional Object-Oriented Programming experience, preferably C#
Experience with concurrent development using Git or similar DVCS including: branching, pull requests, and merging. Experience with conflict resolution preferred
Experience in the .NET stack, including: Visual Studio, SQL Server, and the .NET Framework
Ability to quickly learn and utilize new libraries, tools, and technologies
A healthy sense of humor and an egoless approach to working with others.

Bonus Skills and Experience

Experience with “legacy” front end libraries such as backbone.js/marionette.js, knockout.js, modernizr, etc.
Experience with cross-browser compatibilities as far back as IE9
Experience writing maintainable CSS using CSS naming conventions
Experience with Google Analytics and other web traffic tracking script integrations

Our Technology

Front End: several code bases with frameworkless ES5 JavaScript and jQuery, Bootstrap, and Foundation. Small usage of knockout.js.
Backed by the Microsoft technology stack: core web applications are ASP.NET MVC, using C#, Razor Web Pages.
Microsoft Azure Web Sites hosts our Production and staging environments, CI/CD via MS Azure DevOps
Microsoft SQL Server database, stored procedures, SSRS reports and Domo data visualization
Integration with various 3rd-party systems, e.g., Google Analytics, Podio CRM

Benefits

Meaningful work on world-class and industry-changing products
A competitive salary
Monday-Friday work week
Excellent medical, dental, 401k with match and complimentary life insurance
Employee options on voluntary vision, LTD and FSA coverage
Paid Time Off (PTO) and paid holidays
Ultra-casual dress work environment
Flexible schedule
A great office culture

This position will be working out of our Roseville/Folsom office.

We currently have a Senior .NET Developer career opportunity in our Digital Health Solutions Business Unit.

About our Digital Health Solutions Business Unit

Digital Health Solutions empowers health systems to be on the leading edge of consumer experience by transforming every digital touch point along the patient journey. We design, develop, and measure effective digital marketing programs, keeping in mind that every health system has its own unique business goals and marketing challenges.

Headquartered in Somerville, MA. We are a fast-paced, innovative team and we take pride in the quality of our people as well as our work. We’re a relationship based and people focused environment. We’re committed to creating a welcoming and rewarding workplace for clients and employees alike.

The Role

We are looking for a Senior .NET Developer to join our growing team of 80 Sitecore certified professionals and more than 12 MVPs. As one of just a few Platinum Sitecore partners in the U.S., we are dedicated to growing the partnership, our team, and our clients. You’ll have the opportunity to dive into problem solving challenges and think creatively about ways to improve process and implement different processes and technologies.
Responsibilities:
Develop application solutions and enhancements for our CMS websites.
Grow professionally in a supportive environment.
Design software application components using ASP.NET (C#) and other programming tools.
Participate + lead in knowledge improvement opportunities, code reviews, and mentorship.
Work collaboratively as part of an Agile scrum team and participate in daily stand-up meetings.
Triage + resolve complex, systemic issues reported on existing production systems.
Communicate effectively with project managers, product owners, and development team members to facilitate understanding of deliverables, estimates, and prioritization.
Contribute to production deployments, including documentation of technical specifications and release notes.
Bring an infectious, positive, can-do attitude and a relentless aspiration for improvement.
Qualifications:
This job is just right if you have:
Completed a bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of development experience with Microsoft .NET.
2-3+ years of development experience in a CMS such as Sitecore, Sitefinity, or a similar system.
Web development experience using ASP.NET (C#), MVC, SQL Server and Web Services.
Strong understanding of presentation layer technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, and AJAX.
Experience explaining functionality to both internal audiences and clients.

Bonus Points
Sitecore Certification.
Microsoft Certifications for .NET, C#, AD, MVC.
Familiarity with Drupal.
Familiarity with MongoDB.

What You’ll Be Working With:
Our technologies: .NET, Sitecore
Hosting: Azure
DevOps: TeamCity, Octopus, Proget
Monitoring: New Relic
Our team of passionate, curious, innovative professionals

What We Can Offer You
Fifteen days of paid time off plus 6 designated company holidays and 4 floating holidays.
Comprehensive healthcare, Dental and Vision coverage.
401(k) plan options and 3% match including company stock.
Short Term Disability Insurance, Long Term Disability Insurance, and Life Insurance.
Flex spending account for out-of-pocket medical expenses.
Company sponsored charity opportunities.
Seriously awesome people to work with.

Job Profile Summary

Responsible for delivering relevant analysis and modelling to provide commercial insight, utilising relationships to stay up to date with internal developments in statistical techniques, whilst identifying process improvements and applying insights from the external environment.

Job advert

Role synopsis:
The Data Analytics team within the BP Supply & Trading, Trading Analytics organization comprises Quantitative Analytics, Data Strategists, Market Intelligence and Core Strategists. Linked by the common themes of data, numerical algorithms and technology, the team seeks to add value to the business by providing new models, tradable insights, distinctive data sets and agile technology solutions that empower the analyst community and advantage the commercial teams.

The Core Strategist team provides direct technology support to analysts, worldwide. Located in each of BP’s main trading locations, these individuals possess expert IT knowledge and strong technical skills, combining deep programming know-how with practical experience of analytics, for example data science methods, statistics, numerical algorithms, derivative pricing or optimization. Tasked with providing prompt, practicable technology solutions to analysts day-to-day, they also partner with the central IT organization for strategic deliveries, including modern data repositories, data ontologies, new analytical toolkits, visualization technologies and cloud compute.

An opportunity for a Python Developer - Core Strategist is now available in our downtown Chicago office. Working in a close partnership with the head of oil analytics, you will design and build solutions to challenging business problems in a highly dynamic commercial environment.

Key Accountabilities:
As part of a highly technical global team you will build direct relationships with key analysts and commercial stakeholders, understand their business requirements and immediate goals.
Highly networked within both the Core Strategist team and the central IT organization you will play a leading role in advancing the analyst technology agenda across regions.
Be held by the business as a deep technical authority and source of expert guidance to the analyst community. Provide day-to-day problem solving support and proactively share best practice.
Create efficient, resilient and innovative solutions using modern data analytics technologies that enable analysts, inform decision making and drive revenue generation.
Partner with analysts to develop custom interactive dashboard visualization solutions using web technologies and third-party frameworks.
Design and build scalable, reusable components and frameworks in-line with mandated architectures. Rigorously adhere to software development best practice for enterprise-grade applications.
Make significant contributions to the shared proprietary model libraries for use by analysts globally.
Work with the architecture and infrastructure teams in central IT to ensure that designs are aligned with the company technology strategy. Provide input to IT and play a key interfacing role between them and the analyst community
Act as a Trading Analytics Product Owner for strategic projects undertaken by the centralized IT teams

Essential Education:
Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline, plus a postgraduate degree in a STEM subject.
Strong academic record.

Essential experience and job requirements:
You will have deep practical experience and knowledge of:
Python programming, including knowledge of pandas, numpy, Jupyter. Ability to write production ready, highly reliable, tuned (pythonic) numerical code.
Web services architecture, ideally within Python context (flask, django). Practical experience building web applications and web services.
Strong web technology skills and understanding.
Knowledge of SQL and RDBMs.
UI development, with a strong emphasis on data visualization. Knowledge of charting frameworks including Plotly, matplotlib and bokeh.
Object oriented programming in a second language, for example Java, C++, C# or.NET.
Software development industry best practice, including unit, integration and regression testing. Build and deploy patterns.
Source code control systems, preferably Git.

About BP

We are a global energy business involved in every aspect of the energy system. We have 75,000 employees in 80 countries, working towards delivering light, heat and mobility to millions of people, every day. We are one of the very few companies equipped to solve some of the big complex challenges that matter for the future. We have a real contribution to make to the world's ambition of a low carbon future. Join us, and be part of what we can accomplish together.

Our supply and trading business connects BP to the world’s traded markets for oil, gas, power, refinery feedstocks and currencies. We market BP’s equity crude oil and natural gas, import feedstocks for our refinery system and buy products to meet marketing demand. We offer a combination of unique expertise in physical supply and trading, innovative financial structures, and world-class analytics to deliver long-term value, from wellhead to end customer.

Job Description
Insureio Technologies, Inc. has an immediate opening for a Senior Ruby Developer for a contract-to-perm or permanent position. Only senior level engineers will be considered. Non-local candidates will be considered and remote work is an option; however, preference will be given to local candidates and those willing to relocate to Roseville. We offer salary, health/dental/vision insurance, paid time off, 401K, and other benefits.
Ideal Candidate
Should be handy with an entire tech stack and can provide basic server maintenance functions. Work entails the following:
Work with a small team of programmers to develop SaaS
Write clear, maintainable code in Ruby on Rails and AngularJS
Write automated tests (Think TDD & BDD)
Collaborate with product owners to ensure product enhancements are reasonable and architecturally appropriate
Develop all portions of a Ruby on Rails-based web application, including front-end JavaScript and CSS components; continually enhance the test suite
Maintain existing applications in Ruby on Rails
Maintain Linux servers
Skills & Requirements
Candidate should meet the following requirements:
English fluency on par with that of a native speaker
3+ years of software development
2+ years with Ruby on Rails
2+ years with SQL (or any SQL-like RDBMS)
2+ years with HTML, CSS, Javascript
Fluency in Java, Linux command line, jQuery, AngularJS, Apache, and Git
Bonus:
Familiarity with IIS
Working knowledge of Rails 2, 3, & 4
Working knowledge of C# & .NET
Experience with Linode
Interested?
Submit resume, short cover letter describing yourself, interests, hobbies, experience pertaining to this role, and no less than 3 professional references from entities contained in the resume to: ryan@insureio.com.

JOB DESCRIPTION

We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the RSI Frontline Development team working to address hot fixes, feature enhancements, collaborating with other developers on best practices, code reviews and process improvements. RSI’s team develops Revenue Premier® Enterprise Management products built in an N-tier architecture using a hybrid of C# and Java components on a SQL Server database.


Your role:

Responsibilities in the first year will include determining feasibility of/implementing change requests, investigating root causes of unexpected application behavior, addressing issues raised via ticketing system and following up with client-side colleagues. You will also share your experience by mentoring junior developers as they grow their technical skill base.

The position is challenging, but RSI provides support, training and you provide critical thinking and drive to achieve and streamline processes. Base salaries are just one aspect of our entire compensation package that may include medical, dental, and vision benefits, ability to contribute to flexible spending accounts and 401(K) plans, relocation assistance, ten paid holidays split between fixed holidays and floating holidays, and paid time off. Position is local to Roseville, CA.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
Immediate authorization to work in the US
5+ years of experience with one or more programming languages (i.e. C#, ASP, .NET, SQL, XML, JAVA)
Familiarity with standard development techniques (SDLC, OOD)
Strong analytical problem solving skills
Passion for investigation, troubleshooting, and debugging
Ability to work with a high degree of independence and manage a dynamic workload
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Outgoing and enthusiastic personality
Professional business demeanor

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE, SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:
Advanced degree
Knowledge of Relational Databases, Object Oriented Design, and Data Structures
Familiarity with web programming (HTML/DHTML, XML, CSS, JavaScript)
Prior internship or work experience in a commercial software development environment

**RSI is an equal opportunity employer**

Overview:

Join Perficient and our team of national consultants who deliver thrilling customer experience solutions to Fortune 500 clients and some of the most recognized brands on the planet.

We currently have a Lead .NET Developer career opportunity in our Digital Health Solutions Business Unit.

About our Digital Health Solutions Business Unit
Digital Health Solutions empowers health systems to be on the leading edge of consumer experience by transforming every digital touch point along the patient journey. We design, develop, and measure effective digital marketing programs, keeping in mind that every health system has its own unique business goals and marketing challenges.

Headquartered in Somerville, MA, we are a fast-paced, innovative team and we take pride in the quality of our people as well as our work. We’re a relationship based and people focused environment. We’re committed to creating a welcoming and rewarding workplace for clients and employees alike.

The Role
We are looking for a Lead Sitecore Developer to join our growing team of 80 Sitecore certified professionals and more than 12 MVPs. As one of just a few Platinum Sitecore partners in the U.S., we are dedicated to growing the partnership, our team, and our clients.

In this role, you’ll manage complex technical issues and influence our methodologies and best practices. In addition to development, triage, and code-reviews, you will impact processes for development, dev-ops, site performance and monitoring, and hosting. As a natural leader, you'll mentor fellow team members who are responsible for building, maintaining, improving, and hosting a best-in-class suite of healthcare websites. Your get-it-done approach will be the key to your success, while inspiring accountability and action in others.
Responsibilities:
Roll up your sleeves to solve an array of complex technical problems from performance issues to failed builds, deployment, maintenance, and hosting.
Research and understand new technologies quickly in order to architect, develop prototypes, or provide estimates.
Serve as a client escalation point, providing business level explanations to complex technical questions and issues.
Solve and triage internal delivery issues with a root-cause view, understanding how to prevent similar issues in the future.
Seek to thoroughly understand our processes and methodologies; understand what works and what doesn’t, build improvements, and champion the best practices.
Identify opportunities to enable faster cycles to production and higher quality releases for our clients and services.
Code review the work of other developers on the team, evaluating maintainability, performance and security standards compliance.
Lead and inspire exceptional delivery in all things technology, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and with high quality.
Qualifications:
The job is just right if you have:
7+ years of development experience, preferably with Microsoft .NET.
A minimum of 5 years of development experience with Sitecore CMS.
In-depth experience in enterprise-class web development, maintenance, performance improvement, hosting, and deployment projects.
A penchant for evaluative problem solving and ability to provide quick solutions for critical issues and long-term solutions to prevent their recurrence.
Experience working in source control, like Subversion, or GIT.
Web development skills using ASP.NET (C#), MVC, SQL Server, and web services.
A working understanding of Windows Server and IIS setup and configuration.
Strong communication skills to balance many technical and non-technical clients and internal business partners simultaneously.
Motivation to self-direct and a track record of driving change, setting and managing priorities judiciously.
An infectious, positive, can-do attitude and a relentless aspiration for improvement.
A completed bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science, engineering or another relevant area and a background in web development.
Bonus Points
Sitecore Certification.
Microsoft Certifications for .NET, C#, AD, MVC.
Familiarity with Drupal.
Familiarity with MongoDB.
What You'll Be Working With
Our technologies: .NET, PHP, Sitecore, Bootstrap
Hosting: Azure
Configuration management: TeamCity, Octopus
Monitoring: New Relic
Our team of passionate, curious, innovative professionals
What We Can Offer You
Fifteen days of paid time off plus 6 designated company holidays and 4 floating holidays.
Comprehensive healthcare, Dental and Vision coverage.
401(k) plan options and 3% match including company stock.
Short Term Disability Insurance, Long Term Disability Insurance, and Life Insurance.
Flex spending account for out-of-pocket medical expenses.
Company sponsored charity opportunities.
Seriously awesome people to work with.
Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
